title: Remove 'SLA' wording from all user-facing UI text

requirements.text: Remove the word "SLA" from all user-facing text across the Civic Lens website, while keeping the 72-hour deadline functionality intact and communicating the same concept using alternative wording (e.g., "72-hour response window", "Deadline", "Time remaining", "Due by").

quotes: Can you remove the sla word from the website

acceptanceCriteria: No visible UI text contains the substring "SLA" (case-insensitive) on the landing page, dashboards, complaint lists, and complaint detail views.
The landing page copy that currently says "72-hour SLA" / "72-hour SLA guarantee" is updated to an alternative phrase that does not include "SLA" (e.g., "72-hour response window").
The complaint metadata label "SLA Status" is updated to an alternative label that does not include "SLA" (e.g., "Deadline status" or "Response deadline").
The time remaining/overdue indicators continue to display as before (no changes to due dates, timers, escalation behavior, or status logic).

constraints: Do not change backend data fields (e.g., dueAt) or the 72-hour deadline/escalation logic; this is a terminology/copy-only change.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing components instead).
nonGoals: Renaming internal component filenames/identifiers such as SlaBadge (only user-facing text must change).
Changing the 72-hour deadline duration or how overdue/escalation is computed.
